Title: Press release: Use of Google Analytics for web analytics
Description: The Danish Data Protection Agency has looked into the tool Google Analytics, its settings, and the terms under which the tool is provided. On the basis of this review, the Danish Data Protection Agency concludes that the tool cannot, without more, be used lawfully. Lawful use requires the implementation of supplementary measures in addition to the settings provided by Google.

Title: Denmark declares Google Analytics unlawful
Description: After Austria, France, and Italy, Denmark has become the fourth country to declare the use of Google Analytics unlawful. This decision was stated in a press release from the DPA itself and is the result of a coordinated approach at a European level.

Title: 0xPARC
Description: Supporting application R&D on Ethereum and decentralized platforms.

Title: AWS vs GCP reliability is wildly different
Description: Cloud compute is usually seen as an ethereal resource. You launch VMs and spin them down, billed to the second. The billing and the mental model make it seem like these resources are limitless. That's typically one of the selling points versus on-prem compute. They can scale responsively to your load so you're not paying for excess compute that you don't need but it's there when you want it.

Title: Entitlement in Open Source
Description: There have been discussions in the aftermath of the log4j vulnerability about whether or not open source is broken or sustainable, what we can do to improve the sustainability of the open source ecosystem moving forwards, and the entitlement of users and companies in expecting maintainers to fix their problems.

Title: What is security?
Description: Listen now (40 min) | What do we mean when we say some piece of cryptography is secure? What are cryptographic assumptions? How does modelling security fail in practice?

Title: CK's Cold Dive
Description: Musings about technology, cryptography, and whatever else is on my mind. Click to read CK's Cold Dive, by cronokirby, a Substack publication. Launched 2 months ago.
